intro: Calochortus nigrescens, commonly known as the black-eyed Susan, is a flowering plant native to California and Oregon. It is characterized by its showy, yellow petals that surround a dark, almost black center, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing delicate, cup-shaped flowers. Calochortus nigrescens is a member of the Liliaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance.
